intro: Halesia macgregorii, commonly known as the sweet birch, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The tree produces small, dark blue berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and turn yellow in the fall. Halesia macgregorii thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in mixed hardwood forests.
